intro: Vittadinia alinae, commonly known as the Alina's everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Vittadinia alinae is a perennial herb that is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
